One day, True and her friends found a big, open space to play. They decided to have a spinning contest. Each friend would spin as fast as they could, and the one who spun the longest would win.
True spun and spun, going faster and faster. Her friends cheered her on, amazed at how long she could spin. Finally, True stopped spinning and fell to the ground, laughing. She had won the contest! Her friends clapped and laughed with her, and they all continued to play and spin until the sun went down.

The other students were very nosy about Fuzzy and wanted to know how he had gained such a cool new friend. The pupil was very proud to tell them the story and soon enough everyone wanted a pet of their own!

The other animals tried to talk to the new friend. "Welcome to our planet!" they said. But the new animal did not listen. It just wanted to play and have fun.
The other animals felt sad. They wanted the new animal to be their friend. They tried to teach the new animal to be patient. "Please wait," they said. "We can all play together soon." The new animal learned to be patient and listened to the other animals. They all played together and had lots of fun. The new animal was happy and made many friends.
The moral of the story is: Be patient and listen to others

how to agree and play together.

no. The bad person got angry and said threatening words. The king paused, not sure what to do. Then the king thought of a plan. He said to the bad person, "If I give you three pieces of gold, will you leave my kingdom?”
The bad person stopped and thought for a moment. Finally, he said, “Yes, I will leave for three pieces of gold.” The king agreed and the bad person left.
The king was very relieved that the bad person had gone. He was so happy, he quickly gathered three pieces of gold and gave them to the bad person.

and worried. 
Jack felt bad for the puppy, so he whispered, "Hi! I'm Jack. Who are you?" 
The puppy didn't answer. It just looked at Jack with its big, brown eyes.
Then, Jack noticed that the puppy had a collar. On the collar, it said 'Chloe'. Jack smiled. "Nice to meet you, Chloe!" he said to the puppy. 
Chloe seemed to recognize her name and cocked her head to the side. She was no longer scared or worried.
